references.paper_title: Finite-time analysis of the multiarmed bandit problem
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of multi-armed bandits, providing the key theoretical underpinnings for many of the algorithms discussed in the current work.

references.paper_title: College admissions and the stability of marriage
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of stable matching, a core concept in two-sided matching markets which is central to the problems addressed in the current paper.
This paper is among the first to formally introduce the problem of bandit learning in matching markets, laying the groundwork for many subsequent studies, including the current one.

references.paper_title: Original analysis for bandit learning in matching markets with serial dictatorship
references.reason: This recent work addresses a specific case of matching markets with serial dictatorship, providing a refined theoretical analysis and serving as a point of comparison for the results presented in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Player-optimal stable regret for bandit learning in matching markets
references.reason: This paper, closely related to the current work, addresses the player-optimal stable regret in matching markets, providing a state-of-the-art result that is improved upon in this paper
